page.title: 05HISTORIC BICESTER.
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY: Bicester is thought to be of Saxon origin.The first authentic reference was in the 1086 Domesday Survey,when it is called Berencestra and had 2 manors and 2 mills,and it belonged to Robert d'Oily who built Oxford Castle. In 1182 an Augustine priory was built by Gilbert de Basset and it probably stood on the site of Old Place Yard but only the dovecot now remains. There are many old buildings in the town.In the market place the medieval funnel-shaped plan is still visible. There are many houses dating back to the 16th and 17th centuries. Many famous people have visited the town including Henry V111 who spent many nights here;as did Elizabeth 1. Charles 1 and Oliver Cromwell.
